occupation: Corporate Social Responsibility Manager at Kyndryl
headline: Corporate Social Responsibility Manager at Kyndryl
summary: Monoswita Saha is an experienced, innovative and driven leader with a track record for leading high-level projects, programs and teams to successful outcomes.  Monoswita is a problem solver who dreams big, acts with intention and is committed to fostering ecosystems for equity.  Monoswita holds a bachelor’s degree in economics and English from the University of Connecticut and a master’s degree in public administration from the Columbia University School of International and Public Affairs (SIPA).

experiences.title: Manager, Education and Skills
experiences.description: Led program development and implementation for Pathways in Technology (P-TECH), IBM's marquee workforce development model, linking underserved youth to employment pipelines.  Hired, trained, empowered, and managed an 11-person team to drive workforce development across North America P-TECH schools, impacting over 3000 underserved youth.  Drove IBM brand recognition, IBM thought leadership and activated a global network of advocates. Created and led a global engagement strategy for education, industry, and government leaders across 28 countries to drive workforce readiness and skills development to impact over 125,000 students.  Led the first global summit for over 350 global education professionals, industry leaders and education ministers spanning over 24 countries.  Launched a standard network hiring program which resulted in over 45 hires globally. Spurred innovation and grew business capacity by developing and delivering a free global professional skills curriculum reaching a quarter million users.

experiences.title: Senior Education Program Manager
experiences.description: Built strategic support systems to drive education and skills development across the United States P-TECH network.  Led strategic learning initiatives to empower the P-TECH network for students and educators, including annual convenings for over 100 educations professionals from the global network. Activated an eco-system to ensure sustainability of the Connecticut P-TECH network through political and budget challenges.

experiences.title: Program Manager, Education at IBM Corporate Citizenship & Corporate Affairs at IBM Corpora
experiences.description: Launched Connecticut’s first IBM P-TECH grades 9-14 school, P-TECH Norwalk, and drove workforce development experience through career mentoring, paid internships and ongoing enrichment programming tied to on demand industry trends.  Developed a workforce readiness blueprint for the Connecticut P-TECH network and beyond. Led and guided the collaboration between IBM, K12, higher education, government, and business partners to scale and support P-TECH.

experiences.company: Citi Group Global Commodities Research: Political and Economic Impact of Rare Earths
experiences.title: Graduate Team Leader
Research Associate
experiences.description: Developed best strategies for biotech cluster development through research and constructing case studies focused in South America and Africa. Edited, contributed to and helped design the Agribusiness Training Module for infoDev’s 4th Global Forum for the Incubator Manager Training Program in Helsinki, Finland. Researched and created an economic snapshot of potential cluster development in Kyrgyzstan.Assistant proposal writer and editor for “Ethiopia Climate Resistant Green Economy”

experiences.title: Manager of Corporate and Foundation Relations
experiences.description: Led strategic planning to achieve ambitious revenue, donor growth, and retention goals.  Consistently surpassed the portfolio targets by securing between 30-35 percent of the regions operating budget. Acted as the region’s primary written voice for funders at all stages of development and corporate engagements.  Led the communications strategy for the region’s most high stakes funding events, such as the annual benefit dinner.  Expanded beyond the role to build and drive leadership development programs to empower corps members to build community relationships in four placement cities.

experiences.title: Corps Member
experiences.description: Pushed the bar to set high expectations always and fought for students to experience a meaningful education inside and outside of the classroom.  Designed and taught the ELA curriculum for grades 9, 10 and 12, serving a student population in and out of the juvenile justice system and adult incarceration system.  Built, launched and secured funding for an extra-curricular writers workshop for grades 9, 10, 11 and 12 where students regularly performed their work in community literary gatherings. Launched, led and secured funding and special district permissions for several out of school enrichment experiences such trips to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, theater performances and hiking excursions.

education.school: Columbia University - School of International and Public Affairs

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: University Scholar
accomplishment_honors_awards.description: The University Scholar Program, one of the most prestigious and distinguished programs for undergraduates at the University of Connecticut. Graduation as a university scholar is one of the highest academic honors the University bestows on undergraduate students. No more than thirty University Scholars are selected each year.As a University Scholar:Conducted economic research and field work in Karnataka, Gujarat and West Bengal to analyze the impact of globalization on different socioeconomic levels and sustainable economic developmentEconomic Thesis: “Sustainable Living Initiatives in West Bengal, India.”English Thesis: Garaam Chai and Starbucks Coffee: Voices of Globalization

recommendations: Erin Hellthaler                                                                                Monoswita is a highly skilled writer. She has a unique ability to create professional yet compelling reports and proposals. She is incredibly reliable, produces outstanding work, and demonstrates care for colleagues. Monoswita is thoughtful and analytical and continuously raises the bar for herself and those around her. Above all, Monoswita is driven – she sets goals and she meets them. As a leader she has tremendous integrity and takes full ownership of her work and her actions. This is a stand-out quality that others consistently notice and admire.

Stanley S. Litow                                                                                Monsowita Saha is an extremely motivate and gifted professional. She has in depth knowledge about public education issues and the nexus between elementary and secondary schools, higher education and careers. She was able to innovate and then navigate a range of very difficult policy issues on the ground at both the school level and state level helping to develop and then implement a range of very practical solutions that have made a difference in the lives of many students. I would strongly recommend her, Stan Litow
